Just had my third application to register my bus turned down....So, so P'd off with them.

So my first application was turned down on the grounds that the bus wasn't on NOVA ( fair enough it was brought in pre 2013 when the systems changed ) and lack of Proof of Year evidence. Now I thought maybe I had just forgotten to include the VW Historic club proof that the importer had given me.

So attempt 2, had been in touch with Nova sent them my C&E389 form, had them returned with a pre Apr 2013 stamp. Made sure that the Vehicle year proof from the Volkswagen Owners club saying it was a 61 as in there, got to be a winner I thought.....Nope got rejected because the proof of age from the VW Owners club did not state how the Owners club had arrived at that decision eg, visual identification, photos etc.

Ok so I was a bit peeved at that, got in touch with the VW owners club and explained that the document that I had ( from them given to the importer and then to me ) didn't include how the date was decided etc. Got told that I would need to join the club and then send them pics etc and they will send one with all the info the DVLA needed. Bit miffed because I already had proof from them so now I have to join to get it updated ! But OK, if it means I get it registered.

So....Got the new proof though, didn't take anything out of the envelope the DVLA returned to me just added the new proof of age and AGAIN paid for signed for - tracked delivery.

At this point I am thinking I'm onto a winner. Clare phoned me up at work this arvo.... "Sorry babe, you are gonna be so P'd off" yep they have rejected it for the third time. Saying there is no proof of date !!!!! They even stapled the proof of age along with the other bits to their rejection !!!! Seriously What the F*** and now they have included one other thing that the never mentioned previously asking about export docs .


What a bunch of complete f'in idiots!

Andy

posts.content:
Andy, are you not able to deal with one person at DVLA by phone ? Get the name off the rejection letter and ask exactly what they require ? Seems to me the only thing missing is the manufacture date ?

From the chassis number you should be able to narrow it right down to the month/year ? Further, the m code may tell you more, using the m code decoder on the SSVC ?

What you have to get to grips with is the fact that there are now no Local Vehicle Licensing Offices, it was all centralised at DVLA. Can you imagine all the applications that pass through that particular division now ? To cope with the demand they have bought in people not really au fait with all this, as a result hundreds like you end up going mad !

Try to find the time to ring the person rejecting the application, if you feel that your still not getting your application properly addressed escalate to someone higher. It won't be long and your application will proceed, they don't have time for aggro !

Good Luck and keep us posted as to how the numb nuts at DVLA resolve this

Above all, KEEP CALM and keep it stock !

posts.content:
Hi Jayvanman, your lucky day, The Magic8ball has seen your question. Firstly 2009 is pre nova so you don't have to register via this system legally. NOVA came into effect early 2014.

All you really need is confirmation of the Bus details ie year if manufacture, what it is etc. Speak with Steve Saunders of the SSVC van register and if your a member you can obtain a letter of vehicle details from the SSVC which is recognised by the DVLA. You then need to fill out the form that DVLA supply (can take up to ten days to get to you ) you can order the forms online.

If you actually read the forms and the guidance notes it's usually quite straight forward. That said if you don't enclose all the documents it can be quite protracted. Obviously if your vehicle is post 60 you will need a MOT.you won't be able to do anything without a MOT on the chassis number.

I'll be keeping a watchful eye on this thread, remember Magic8Ball is keen to see bureaucracy eradicated so we can all enjoy our splits...ta ra

Hi all,

Bit of a thread resurrection I know but a word of warning to anyone with a pre 1960 bus that they are trying to register........ the DVLA are out to make your life interesting!

I applied and sent in proof of age from the Historic VW club and waited...... and waited. Hearing nothing after probably three weeks, I phoned only to be told that they needed a vehicle inspection. My bus is mid-resto but I thought, 'as long as they can see the number and ID it, no worries'. Unfortunately this is not what happened. They inspected it, I waited another 6/8 weeks and still heard nothing. I phoned again and it turned out they had not actioned the info in the report.

They then rejected my application saying that as the vehicle is incomplete and not fit for road use, so they are unable to register it. On top of that, they have also said that I need to complete the V627/1 Built Up Vehicle report which puts me into the 'finding serial numbers and proving it shouldnt be on a Q plate' fun and games. If I'd gone Red 9, I would be on Q plates for sure. Although I still dont need an MOT.

Not sure if anyone else has dealt with this but. Christ-on-a bike they are usless.

Rant over!

Jon
